de.ityx.mediatrix.api.server

Interface ISTextObject

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IControl, ISCommon, ISConnect

    public interface ISTextObject
extends ISCommon
    Provides functions to manage text objects.
    How to use:
    API.getServerAPI().getTextObjectAPI().save(con, to);

      • getTextObjects

        List<ITextObject> getTextObjects(Connection con,
                               List<Object> parameters)
                                 throws SQLException
        Gets all the ITextObjects for the parameters.
        Parameters:
        con - connection to the database.
        parameters - parameters
        You can put 3 or 6 parameters into a map:
        3 parameters:
        at position 0: subproject id of the textObject
        at position 1: project id of the textObject
        at position 2: state of the textObject
        6 parameters:
        at position 0: category id id of the textObject
        at position 1: text part of the textObject
        at position 2: true, if all informations like body of the textObjects must be loaded
        at position 3: true, if all informations like body of the textObjects must be loaded
        at position 4: true, if not deactivated an only valid textObject must be searched
        at position 5: true, search textObject with category id at position 0
        Returns:
        ITextObject
        Throws:
        SQLException - if a database access error occurs or this method is called on a closed connection.
        was:
        sucheTextbaustein

      • setCategoryInTextObject

        void setCategoryInTextObject(Connection con,
                           ITextObject textObject,
                           int status)
                             throws SQLException
        Sets the category from a text objects.
        Deletes the old category for this Text-Object IF it matches the status parameter
        Then adding new categories from the Text-Object ITextObject.getCategoryIds()
        with the status-parameter.
        Parameters:
        con - connection to the database.
        textObject - where to set the category in the database.
        status - to add and delete.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if a database access error occurs or this method is called on a closed connection.
        was:

      • writeHistory

        boolean writeHistory(Connection con,
                   ITextObject textObject,
                   ITextHistory history,
                   int operatorId,
                   int active,
                   long releaseDate)
                     throws SQLException
        Simple:
        To add a new history to an existing Text-Object.
        Complicated:
        Because you can also use this method to import Text-Object-Histories this Method is kind of broken.
        If you don't want to import a Text-Object-History leave the history parameter null.
        Then this method will add a new Text-Object-History while incrementing the version.
        Also documents of the Text-Object will be stored.

        If you want to use this method to import Text-Object-Histories, don't leave the history parameter null.
        Then this method will simply import that Text-Object-History to the specific textObject.
        Please also note that this method does not check for any consistency errors!
        Parameters:
        con - connection to the database.
        textObject - according to the Text-Object-History.
        history - which to add/import, can be null read the description.
        operatorId - of the Operator which made that action.
        active - 1 or 2
        releaseDate - self explaining.
        Returns:
        true if everything went fine, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if a database access error occurs or this method is called on a closed connection.

      • clearHistory

        boolean clearHistory(Connection con,
                   ITextObject textObject)
                     throws SQLException
        This method sets the valid-from and valid-till date for the Text-Object.
        If the Text-Object's valid-from time is not before valid-till this method will correct it and set
        valid-from=valid=valid-till
        Parameters:
        con - connection to the database.
        textObject - to clear theTtext-Object.
        Returns:
        true if everything went fine, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if a database access error occurs or this method is called on a closed connection.

      • getMaxHistory

        int getMaxHistory(Connection con,
                ITextObject textObject)
                  throws SQLException
        Searches via the ITextObject-Id in the database for the highest version of it.
        Parameters:
        con - connection to the database.
        textObject -
        Returns:
        1 if nothing could be found, the highest Version otherwise.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if a database access error occurs or this method is called on a closed connection.

      • getTextObjectHistories

        List<ITextObject> getTextObjectHistories(Connection con,
                                       int projectId,
                                       int categoryId,
                                       String text,
                                       boolean loadLongText)
                                         throws SQLException
        Searches for text objects which have a valid version at the time the query has been started. Only Text-Objects
        which can be used for replying emails will be returned. Parameters for searching are project id, category id,
        part of the text. loadLongText determines whether to load the full text of the text object
        Parameters:
        con - connection to the database.
        projectId - project id
        categoryId - category id
        text - part of a text from the text object
        loadLongText - true, if long text of the text object will be loaded
        Returns:
        list of ITextObjects.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if a database access error occurs or this method is called on a closed connection.

      • getTextObjectHistories

        List<ITextObject> getTextObjectHistories(Connection con,
                                       int projectId,
                                       int categoryId,
                                       String text,
                                       boolean loadLongText,
                                       boolean conjunction,
                                       Set<Language> languages)
                                         throws SQLException
        Searches for text objects which have a valid version at the time the query has been started. Only textobjekts
        which can be used for replying eMails will be returned.

        You can search for TextObjects with the AND or OR conjunction
        Sample TextObject:
        Subject: This is a TextObject
        Body: Hello World from Germany!

        With the given parameter text (This is b) and the conjunction AND
        you would find nothing instead if you use OR and the same text, you would find the sample TextObject.
        NOTE that the text affects the subject and the text!

        Another example for the language parameter:
        Given a TextObject 'A' with the language: German.
        You can find this TextObject under this circumstances:
        • The parameter languages is empty.
        • languages contains German.
        • languages contains Language.L_ALL
        NOTE that you'll also find TextObjects which have no language assigned (e.g. Language.L_ALL)
        Parameters:
        con - connection to the database.
        projectId - The project id.
        categoryId - category id of the TextObject, -1 for all.
        text - part of a text from a TextObject.
        loadLongText - determines whether to load the full text of the text object.
        conjunction - true means the logical AND, and false OR.
        languages - Languages to search for.
        Returns:
        list of ITextObjects.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if a database access error occurs or this method is called on a closed connection.
